title: Approaching Local People Safely
brief: How to make safe, respectful first contact with local populations in survival situations.
steps: Step 1: Approach slowly and do not rush your contact - many local peoples are shy.
Step 2: Smile as often as possible to appear non-threatening.
Step 3: Use sign language or act out your needs and questions.
Step 4: Learn a few basic words and phrases in the local language before operations.
Step 5: Watch and learn local customs by observing before interacting.
Step 6: Treat all people with respect - never bully or laugh at them.
warnings: Do not touch people without understanding local taboos - touching may be dangerous.
Some areas may be taboo (religious, sacred, diseased, or dangerous places).
People may falsely claim others are hostile simply due to cultural misunderstanding.
